1.name: Gold
1.extraTooltipInfo: Gold is used to purchase items from the market and shops. You can get more gold by selling resources or fighting monsters.

2.name: Heat
2.extraTooltipInfo: Heat is used to smelt bars and cook food. You can get heat by burning various items such as logs, branches, driftwood, coal, and ability books.

3.name: Air Essence
3.extraTooltipInfo: Air Essence can be gathered by waiting patiently.

4.name: Earth Essence
4.extraTooltipInfo: Earth Essence can be gathered while mining.

5.name: Fire Essence
5.extraTooltipInfo: Fire Essence can be gathered while smithing or cooking.

6.name: Water Essence
6.extraTooltipInfo: Water Essence can be gathered by fishing.

7.name: Blood Essence
7.extraTooltipInfo: Blood Essence can be gathered by dealing damage.

8.name: Death Essence
8.extraTooltipInfo: Death Essence can be gathered by killing opponents.

9.name: Chaos Essence
9.extraTooltipInfo: Chaos Essence can be gathered by attempting to hit an enemy.

10.name: Nature Essence
10.extraTooltipInfo: Nature Essence can be gathered by foraging and farming.

11.name: Mind Essence
11.extraTooltipInfo: Mind Essence can be gathered by enchanting and augmenting items or using magic in combat.

12.name: Cosmic Essence
12.extraTooltipInfo: Cosmic Essence can be gathered by enchanting or runecrafting.

20.name: Platinum
20.extraTooltipInfo: Platinum is used to purchase items from the Platinum Shop and to purchase server-wide Global Buffs.

50.name: Book
50.extraTooltipInfo: A dusty tome. Perhaps I should read it?

60.name: Raw Shrimp
60.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking and bait. S h r i m p

61.name: Raw Anchovy
61.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking and bait. In what scape would these look like blue shrimp?

62.name: Raw Trout
62.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking and bait. The fisherman's participation award.

63.name: Raw Salmon
63.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking and bait. Not going up any rivers anymore.

64.name: Raw Lobster
64.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. Raw Lobster!

65.name: Raw Tuna
65.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. Tuna Tuna Tuna

66.name: Raw Shark
66.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. A big toothy fish. It's a fish, right?

67.name: Raw Megalodon
67.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. A monstrously large shark with incredibly tough meat.

68.name: Raw Ancient Lobster
68.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. A mean looking and monstrously heavy lobster. It's definitely a lot older than you are.

69.name: Raw Tentacle Meat
69.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking and bait. A massive chunk of ancient rubbery meat torn from some sort of tentacled monster.

70.name: Raw Huge Tuna
70.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. A huge tuna!

71.name: Seaweed
71.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. Smells real bad.

72.name: Raw Magnetic Minnow
72.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. It didn't even bite the hook, it just got stuck to it.

73.name: Raw Tigerfish
73.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. Mean looking and strong to boot!

74.name: Raw Slippery Eel
74.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. Slippery and oily!

75.name: Raw Great White Shark
75.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. A deadly creature to be sure.

76.name: Raw Hammerhead Shark
76.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. Probably can't actually be used as a hammer.

77.name: Raw Crab
77.extraTooltipInfo: An ingredient for cooking. In some places it's considered less desirable than lobster, but not here.

95.name: Burnt Fish
95.extraTooltipInfo: The result of an overzealous cook. Perhaps studying this will make you a better cook?

96.name: Burnt Food
96.extraTooltipInfo: The result of an overzealous cook. Perhaps studying this will make you a better cook?

101.name: Copper Ore
101.extraTooltipInfo: Can be smelted into bronze bars with the help of some tin.

102.name: Tin Ore
102.extraTooltipInfo: Can be smelted into bronze bars with the help of some copper.

103.name: Iron Ore
103.extraTooltipInfo: Can be smelted into the most basic of basic metal bars, iron.

104.name: Gold Ore
104.extraTooltipInfo: A large chunk of gold ready to be smelted into a bar.

105.name: Mithril Ore
105.extraTooltipInfo: A dark blue tinted and hardy metal that can be smelted into bars.

106.name: Adamantite Ore
106.extraTooltipInfo: A green hued metal most consider nearly worthless that can be smelted into bars.

107.name: Runite Ore
107.extraTooltipInfo: One of the hardest naturally occuring metals that may be smelted into tough bars.

108.name: Clay
108.extraTooltipInfo: Used in crafting. It may not be what plants crave, but you could probably mix this with sand to make fertilizer.

109.name: Stone
109.extraTooltipInfo: Used in crafting. A solid foundation for castles... but who would want that?

110.name: Sand
110.extraTooltipInfo: Used in crafting and cooking. One can find great nutrients in sand for fertilizer, though eating the sand itself doesn't seem like a good idea...

111.name: Silver
111.extraTooltipInfo: A great material for channeling magic essence.

112.name: Coal
112.extraTooltipInfo: Burn it up to make heat! It's okay, the industrial revolution hasn't happened yet so you're safe from environmental activists.

114.name: Stygian Ore
114.extraTooltipInfo: An unnaturally glittering ore sourced from the deepest of delves. May be smelted into bars with the aid of ichor.

115.name: Void Stone
115.extraTooltipInfo: A stone pulsing with chaotic energy. Perhaps you could further process it?

150.name: Fertilizer
150.extraTooltipInfo: Stinky sack of nutrients. Increases minimum yield and experience of plants and somehow traps in farming.

craftingStats.description: Stinky sack of nutrients. Increases minimum yield and experience of plants in farming.

151.name: Carrot Seed
151.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. Won't improve your vision yet.

152.name: Peppercorn Seed
152.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. May cause uncontrolled sneezing on harvest.

153.name: Sugarcane Seed
153.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm for a sweet treat.

154.name: Wheat Seed
154.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. It's honest work.

155.name: Potato Seed
155.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. Adventurers would often use potatos to show others their desire to dungeon delve with one another.

157.name: Tomato Seed
157.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. Definitely a Vegetable.

158.name: Wildberry Bush Seed
158.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. Careful with the thorns!

159.name: Chili Pepper Seed
159.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. Even the seeds are hot to the touch.

160.name: Pumpkin Seed
160.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. The orange melon.

170.name: Tree Seed
170.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. Good place to take naps under.

173.name: Maple Tree Seed
173.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. Sometimes sticky sap is found on this tree, but it's safe to ignore.

176.name: Apple Tree Seed
176.extraTooltipInfo: Plant this on your farm. Not a good place to take naps under.

177.name: Elder Tree Seed
177.extraTooltipInfo: Every type of forest can be traced back to one of these trees.

180.name: Sageberry Bush Seed
180.extraTooltipInfo: It may be wise to plant this on your farm.

185.name: Mysterious Seed
185.extraTooltipInfo: Life is not necessarily the opposite of corruption. I wonder what this could grow into?

craftingStats.description: The blessing of life steeped in the ooze of corruption.

186.name: Durian Seed
186.extraTooltipInfo: Legend states that these seeds are so fragile, only someone with extraordinary power could remove the seed from the fruit in one piece... It appears to be an award for defeating a powerful enemy, rather than a seed that can be planted.

201.name: Bronze Bar
201.extraTooltipInfo: Used as a basic crafting material.

202.name: Iron Bar
202.extraTooltipInfo: May be used to craft iron equipment or to augment obsidian gear.

203.name: Gold Bar
203.extraTooltipInfo: May be used to craft or augment jewelry. Sadly you aren't authorized to create your own currency.

204.name: Mithril Bar
204.extraTooltipInfo: May be used to craft mithril equipment or to augment obsidian gear.

205.name: Adamantite Bar
205.extraTooltipInfo: A rather limited, yet hard, metal. May be used to create Adamantite gear.

206.name: Runite Bar
206.extraTooltipInfo: One of the toughest natural metals. May be used to craft Runite equipment.

207.name: Stygian Bar
207.extraTooltipInfo: An unnaturally tough metal that is almost crystalline in nature. May be used to craft Stygian equipment.

208.name: Chaotic Crystal
208.extraTooltipInfo: A condensed crystal formed through processing a large amount of void stones. May be used to craft or enhance unique equipment.

209.name: Obsidian Glass
209.extraTooltipInfo: A splinter of mildly reflective obsidian glass; can be used to augment obsidian or obsidian-adjacent gear.

210.name: Golem Marrow
210.extraTooltipInfo: A piece of golem marrow, the lifeblood of an artificial construct.

211.name: Chaos Stone
211.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. A shard of chaotic essence that is not only contained, but refined. The process to do this is forever lost to the ages.

212.name: Living Shard
212.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. A shard of dense material that pulsates with life. Could it be the heart of some undying creature?

213.name: Runed Stone
213.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. An impossibly heavy stone tablet bearing an unknown rune that still glows with power.

214.name: Magma Core
214.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. A chunk of stone with an unquenchable fire burning within. What could you do with this?

215.name: Heavy Chaos Shard
215.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. An unrefined splinter of chaotic energy. Though dulled compared to the chaos it was drawn from, it may still have a potent effect.

216.name: Worn Ancient Splinter
216.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. A splinter of some long lost metal; it has more in common with stone than it does metal and would require a master craftsman to work it.

217.name: Royal Ice Shard
217.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. A somewhat workable shard of frozen stone sourced from the frozen wastes within the Valley of Giants. Appears to be a material commonly used by Ice Giants to form their accessories; perhaps you could make something useful with it?

301.name: Branch
301.extraTooltipInfo: Used as a crafting material or turned into heat.

302.name: Log
302.extraTooltipInfo: Used as a crafting material or turned into heat.

craftingStats.description: Combine your branches to craft one log

303.name: Oak Log
303.extraTooltipInfo: Used as a crafting material or turned into heat.

304.name: Willow Log
304.extraTooltipInfo: Used as a crafting material or turned into heat.

305.name: Maple Log
305.extraTooltipInfo: Used as a crafting material or turned into heat. Still sticky somehow.

306.name: Yew Log
306.extraTooltipInfo: Used as a crafting material or turned into heat.

307.name: Elder Log
307.extraTooltipInfo: Used as a crafting material or turned into heat.

400.extraTooltipInfo: An inexpensive blue gem that may be used for crafting.

401.extraTooltipInfo: An inexpensive green gem that may be used for crafting.

403.extraTooltipInfo: An uncommon gem that may be used for crafting.

404.name: Black Opal
404.extraTooltipInfo: A rare black gem that may be used for crafting. It is said that you can see the whole universe inside of one of these.

405.name: Runic Etchant
405.extraTooltipInfo: Shards of sapphire suspended in a fermented seaweed solution. Used by master runecrafters in producing precise cuts.

craftingStats.description: Shards of sapphire suspended in a fermented seaweed solution. Used by master runecrafters in producing precise cuts.

406.name: Corrupted Substrate
406.extraTooltipInfo: Finely crushed emerald suspended in strong acid, imbued with corrupted magic

craftingStats.description: Finely crushed emerald suspended in strong acid, imbued with corrupted magic

407.name: Reactive Powder
407.extraTooltipInfo: A combustible red powder, imbued with magic, used in alchemical crafting.

craftingStats.description: A combustible red powder, imbued with magic, used in alchemical crafting.

408.name: Polishing Paste
408.extraTooltipInfo: Finely ground diamond suspended in oil with highly abrasive properties.

craftingStats.description: Finely ground diamond suspended in oil with highly abrasive properties.

409.name: Sanguine Infusion
409.extraTooltipInfo: A highly viscous crimson elixir swirling with the malevolent power of demon blood.

craftingStats.description: A highly viscous crimson elixir swirling with the malevolent power of demon blood.

600.extraTooltipInfo: Slightly better than punching rocks until they break! Adds 10 to your effective mining level when determining speed.

craftingStats.description: Adds 10 to your effective mining level when determining speed.

craftingStats.description: Adds 20 to your mining level when determining speed.

605.extraTooltipInfo: Lighter than it looks, but almost unbreakable. Adds 60 to your effective mining level when determining speed.

craftingStats.description: Adds 60 to your mining level when determining speed.

606.name: Dwarven Rocksmasher
606.extraTooltipInfo: A legendary mining tool using lost dwarven technology.

craftingStats.description: A legendary mining tool using lost dwarven technology.

610.name: Bronze Hatchet
610.extraTooltipInfo: A tool to destroy trees, but it is made of tree. So odd. Adds 10 to your effective foraging level when determining speed.

craftingStats.description: Adds 10 to your effective foraging level when determining speed.

611.name: Iron Hatchet
611.extraTooltipInfo: The forests will face treestruction. Adds 20 to your effective foraging level when determining speed.

craftingStats.description: Adds 20 to your foraging level when determining speed.

612.name: Mithril Hatchet
612.extraTooltipInfo: The enemy of all trees. Adds 30 to your effective foraging level when determining speed.

craftingStats.description: Adds 30 to your foraging level when determining speed.

613.name: Adamantite Hatchet
613.extraTooltipInfo: Trees will fear your tree-felling prowess. Adds 40 to your effective foraging level when determining speed.

craftingStats.description: Adds 40 to your foraging level when determining speed.

614.name: Runite Hatchet
614.extraTooltipInfo: If trees could wear boots, they would be quivering in their tree boots. Adds 50 to your effective foraging level when determining speed.

craftingStats.description: Adds 50 to your foraging level when determining speed.

615.name: Stygian Hatchet
615.extraTooltipInfo: Holding it makes you have treevil thoughts. Adds 60 to your effective foraging level when determining speed.

craftingStats.description: Adds 60 to your foraging level when determining speed.

616.name: The Grovekeeper
616.extraTooltipInfo: A legendary foraging tool. It appears to actually be alive.

craftingStats.description: A legendary foraging tool. It appears to actually be alive.

620.name: Sapphire Ring
620.extraTooltipInfo: A ring capable of holding weak enchantments. Old stories suggest that the bluer the Sapphire the more attuned to the Sea it is.

craftingStats.description: A ring capable of holding weak enchantments.

621.name: Sapphire Necklace
621.extraTooltipInfo: A necklace capable of holding weak enchantments. Despite its lower value and magical potential, pure Sapphires are known to glow in response to the presence of Runecrafting energies.

craftingStats.description: A necklace capable of holding weak enchantments.

622.name: Emerald Ring
622.extraTooltipInfo: A ring capable of holding moderate enchantments. Foragers argue that Emeralds give good luck in the wilderness.

craftingStats.description: A ring capable of holding moderate enchantments.

623.name: Emerald Necklace
623.extraTooltipInfo: A necklace capable of holding moderate enchantments. Farmers claim that the green hue indicates a connection to agriculture.

craftingStats.description: A necklace capable of holding moderate enchantments.

624.name: Ruby Ring
624.extraTooltipInfo: A ring capable of holding decent enchantments. Miners claim that some Rubies glow slightly in the presence of rarer ores.

craftingStats.description: A ring capable of holding decent enchantments.

625.name: Ruby Necklace
625.extraTooltipInfo: A necklace capable of holding decent enchantments. Rubies are highly valued in Goblin society for representing the purity of the Cooking fire.

craftingStats.description: A necklace capable of holding decent enchantments.

626.name: Diamond Ring
626.extraTooltipInfo: A ring capable of holding strong enchantments. One of the hardest natural gems, it is suggested that Diamonds are only naturally found in select chunks of ore when refined in a certain way.

craftingStats.description: A ring capable of holding strong enchantments.

627.name: Diamond Necklace
627.extraTooltipInfo: A necklace capable of holding strong enchantments. Rumored to aid in harnessing Enchanting energies.

craftingStats.description: A necklace capable of holding strong enchantments.

628.name: Prismatic Necklace
628.extraTooltipInfo: A necklace capable of holding extraordinary enchantments.

629.name: Prismatic Ring
629.extraTooltipInfo: A ring capable of holding extraordinary enchantments.

craftingStats.description: A ring capable of holding extraordinary enchantments.

630.name: Black Opal Ring
630.extraTooltipInfo: A ring capable of holding powerful enchantments. Its unnatural gem is rumored to have more devious, magical origins than its more common counterparts.

craftingStats.description: A ring capable of holding powerful enchantments.

631.name: Black Opal Necklace
631.extraTooltipInfo: A necklace capable of holding powerful enchantments. Black Opals are said to be the product of unnatural alchemical processes.

craftingStats.description: A necklace capable of holding powerful enchantments.

640.name: Gold Ring
640.extraTooltipInfo: A simple golden ring, ready to hold limitless potential.

craftingStats.description: A simple golden ring, ready to hold limitless potential.

641.name: Gold Necklace
641.extraTooltipInfo: A simple golden necklace, ready to hold limitless potential.

craftingStats.description: A simple golden necklace, ready to hold limitless potential.

642.name: Corrupted Ring
642.extraTooltipInfo: None are incorruptible. Succumb to the hunger.

craftingStats.description: None are incorruptible. Succumb to the hunger. Once crafted the Corruption enchant will be applied to the ring.

643.name: Ancient Nature Amulet
643.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient energy keeps you from attempting to absorb the talisman. You feel more connected to nature with this around.

644.name: Ancient Fire Amulet
644.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient energy keeps you from attempting to absorb the talisman. With this you could wield an aspect of flame.

645.name: Ancient Water Amulet
645.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient energy keeps you from attempting to absorb the talisman. With this you could wield an aspect of ice.

646.name: Ancient Blood Amulet
646.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient energy keeps you from attempting to absorb the talisman. With this you bathe in the blood of your enemies. Very edgy.

647.name: Ancient Air Amulet
647.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient energy keeps you from attempting to absorb the talisman. It is so light it could almost float in the air on its own.

648.name: Ancient Chaos Amulet
648.extraTooltipInfo: Your instincts refuse to allow you to try and absorb this talisman; you feel as if there is a cost to merely holding it. It shifts in and out of focus if you look too closely.

1199.name: Flimsy Recurve Bow

craftingStats.description: Recurve Bow WIP

1199.extraTooltipInfo: A simple bow, suitable for hunting weak prey.

craftingStats.description: Recurve Bow WIP

1201.name: Oak Recurve Bow

craftingStats.description: Recurve Bow WIP

1201.extraTooltipInfo: A quality bow capable of handling most foes in the human territory. If only it was easier to wash the sap off your hands.

1202.name: Willow Recurve Bow

craftingStats.description: Recurve Bow WIP

1202.extraTooltipInfo: The skull on the bow watches out for you, shows you where to aim, when to shoot. Or maybe youre just getting better at archery. Hard to tell.

1203.name: Maple Recurve Bow

craftingStats.description: Recurve Bow WIP

1203.extraTooltipInfo: A bow almost as strong as the sap is sticky.

1204.name: Yew Recurve Bow

craftingStats.description: Recurve Bow WIP

1204.extraTooltipInfo: The strength of this bow quells all fears that the slithering yew trees are haunted. Well, almost.

1205.name: Elder Recurve Bow

craftingStats.description: Recurve Bow WIP

1205.extraTooltipInfo: The simple design of the recurve bow, perfected.

1206.name: Flimsy Longbow

craftingStats.description: Longbow WIP

1206.extraTooltipInfo: Though it takes a few seconds to line up a shot, it can pierce prey effectively.

1207.name: Sturdy Longbow

craftingStats.description: Longbow WIP

1207.extraTooltipInfo: A stronger bow suitable to take down larger prey and some monsters.

1208.name: Oak Longbow

craftingStats.description: Longbow WIP

1208.extraTooltipInfo: A stronger bow capable of handing tougher threats.

1209.name: Willow Longbow

craftingStats.description: Longbow WIP

1210.name: Maple Longbow

craftingStats.description: Longbow WIP

1210.extraTooltipInfo: This well-carved bow is suitable to take on almost any threat.

1211.name: Yew Longbow

craftingStats.description: Longbow WIP

1211.extraTooltipInfo: A great bow that definitely isnt evil.

1212.name: Elder Longbow

craftingStats.description: Longbow WIP

1212.extraTooltipInfo: An incredible longbow with power like youve never seen. Is it possible to improve this design any further?

1213.name: Flimsy Crossbow

craftingStats.description: Crossbow WIP

1213.extraTooltipInfo: A basic attempt at a one-handed bow. By some miracle, it holds together despite the poor-quality materials.

1214.name: Light Crossbow

craftingStats.description: Crossbow WIP

1214.extraTooltipInfo: An overall improvement to the previous design while still being easy to wield in one hand.

1215.name: Bone Crossbow

craftingStats.description: Crossbow WIP

1215.extraTooltipInfo: Attaching bones to weapons to make them stronger? Utter nonsense.

1216.name: Heavy Crossbow

craftingStats.description: Crossbow WIP

1216.extraTooltipInfo: An impressive weapon, though still a bit awkward to use in one hand.

1217.name: Reinforced Crossbow

craftingStats.description: Crossbow WIP

1217.extraTooltipInfo: An exceptional weapon capable striking down powerful beasts and monsters alike.

1218.name: Arbalest

craftingStats.description: Crossbow WIP

1218.extraTooltipInfo: Youre nearing the limit of simple crossbow technology. Perhaps researching this might lead to new technological developments?

1219.name: Elder Crossbow

craftingStats.description: Crossbow WIP

1219.extraTooltipInfo: Perhaps researching this crossbow will lead to new technological developments?

1220.name: Rough Throwing Knife

craftingStats.description: Throwing WIP

1220.extraTooltipInfo: A roughly carved throwing knife. The runic etching on the blade makes it return to your hand no matter how far you throw it.

1221.name: Throwing Knife

craftingStats.description: Throwing WIP

1221.extraTooltipInfo: In a stroke of genius, you realize you can hollow out the blade to make it fly faster. Structural integrity is for nerds.

1222.name: Light Throwing Knife

craftingStats.description: Throwing WIP

1222.extraTooltipInfo: If you remove any more of the blade, there wont be anything left.

1223.name: Refined Throwing Knife

craftingStats.description: Throwing WIP

1223.extraTooltipInfo: Excessively thin, this blade can slice enemies without them even seeing what hit them.

1224.name: Throwing Axe

craftingStats.description: Throwing WIP

1224.extraTooltipInfo: Finally, a reason to use the sharp end.

1225.name: Throwing Javelin

craftingStats.description: Throwing WIP

1225.extraTooltipInfo: There are records of cave-idlers long ago who stuck sharp stones to sticks to use as weapons. Maybe theres more merit to that than expected.

1226.name: Throwing Spinner

craftingStats.description: Throwing WIP

1226.extraTooltipInfo: A thrown weapon surpassing all others. Don't play with it. You will cut yourself.

1227.name: Driftwood Wand

craftingStats.description: Wand WIP

1227.extraTooltipInfo: This could technically be considered a wand if you look at it from the right angle.

craftingStats.description: Wand WIP
The instructional manuals you found DEFINITELY indicated you should hold it upside-down. You do know how to read though, right?

1300.name: Blademaster's Shroud
1300.extraTooltipInfo: Ragged and torn, the cloth itself appears to remember every battle.

1301.name: Blademaster's Memory
1301.extraTooltipInfo: The distilled knowledge of an ancient warrior. Perhaps you can infuse this into a piece of equipment?

1302.name: Royal Banner
1302.extraTooltipInfo: A banner representing the will and might of humanity, if you believe the propaganda. Heavy and unwieldy to carry, reducing your defenses slightly, but sure to inspire your comrades.

1303.name: Torn Banner
1303.extraTooltipInfo: A torn banner still humming with magical power. You should restore it to its former glory!

1304.name: Necromancer's Cowl
1304.extraTooltipInfo: A magical cowl to hide your face. Somewhat helps with keeping out the stench of the dead.

1305.name: Necromancer's Robe Top
1305.extraTooltipInfo: The robes of a necromancer. Smells like death.

1306.name: Necromancer's Robe Bottoms
1306.extraTooltipInfo: The robe bottoms of a necromancer.

1307.name: Book of Death

craftingStats.description: An unholy text. It will require all your willpower to not be corrupted by it.

1307.extraTooltipInfo: It has a powerful toxic aura. Just touching it feels like breaking a taboo, but great power is often found in such things.

1308.name: Necromancer's Wand

craftingStats.description: A wand imbued with a dark power. You feel as if it is merely letting you control it.

1308.extraTooltipInfo: A wand capable of controlling death itself. Do you dare to take such power into your own hands?

1309.name: Necromancer's Remains
1309.extraTooltipInfo: The rotten belongings of a long dead necromancer. Can be restored through crafting.

1310.name: Royal Elven Remnants
1310.extraTooltipInfo: The remnants of a more civilized past. Can be restored through crafting.

1311.name: Gargoyle Shards
1311.extraTooltipInfo: A burning shard taken from a failed experiment. Can be restored through crafting.

1312.name: Mantis Shrimp Carapace
1312.extraTooltipInfo: A reforged carapace modeled after the strongest shrimp.

craftingStats.description: A carapace that could only be fashioned through the help of a Voidblessed Shrimp.

1313.name: Mantis Shrimp Greaves
1313.extraTooltipInfo: A reforged set of greaves modeled after the strongest shrimp.

craftingStats.description: A pair of greaves that could only be fashioned through the help of a Voidblessed Shrimp.

1314.name: Mantis Shrimp Helm
1314.extraTooltipInfo: A reforged helm modeled after the strongest shrimp.

craftingStats.description: A helm that could only be fashioned through the help of a Voidblessed Shrimp.

1315.name: Mantis Shrimp Shell
1315.extraTooltipInfo: The chitinous shell of the Aberrant Shrimp formed into a shield; it's tainted by some sort of demonic magic. Is this a blessing or a curse?

craftingStats.description: A shield that could only be fashioned through the help of a Voidblessed Shrimp.

1316.name: Mantis Shrimp Gauntlets
1316.extraTooltipInfo: A pair of gauntlets that infuse your punches with the speed and power of the strongest shrimp.

craftingStats.description: A pair of gauntlets that could only be fashioned through the help of a Voidblessed Shrimp.

1317.name: Void-Blessed Shrimp
1317.extraTooltipInfo: It promises vast seas of knowledge if only you would free it. Perhaps it could teach you to use Shrimp Scraps to make equipment?

1318.name: Witchhunter Handgonne
1318.extraTooltipInfo: A weapon that combines the ranged prowess of the elves with the technical ingenuity of the dwarves. A true breakthrough! Can technically be fired one handed.

1319.name: Personal Cannon
1319.extraTooltipInfo: The next logical step to a handgonne- a really big one! A little slower to operate, but packs a much larger punch. Unfortunately does not seem to help with your agility, but at least you can hide behind it!

craftingStats.description: Who doesn't love cannons?

1320.name: Illegal Gun Parts
1320.extraTooltipInfo: A partial component from researching explosive based projectile weapons. Outlawed by Big Magic for potential to unseat their monopoly on things going boom!

1450.name: Shoddy Ammo
1450.extraTooltipInfo: A bunch of shoddily crafted ammunition for ranged weapons.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 32 projectiles.
Each craft results in 32 projectiles.

1452.name: Apprentice Ammo
1452.extraTooltipInfo: Ammo that would be passable as being crafted by an apprentice crafter.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 32 projectiles.

1453.name: Journeyman Ammo
1453.extraTooltipInfo: Ammo that would be passable as being crafted by a journeyman crafter.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 32 projectiles.

1454.name: Professional Ammo
1454.extraTooltipInfo: Ammo that has clearly been crafted by a professional.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 32 projectiles.

1455.name: Master Ammo
1455.extraTooltipInfo: Ammo that has been crafted by a master and is clearly intended for more exotic weaponry. Has enhanced accuracy due to its lighter materials.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 32 projectiles.

1456.name: Experimental Ammo
1456.extraTooltipInfo: An experimental ammo that is on the edge of science and magic! Has enhanced damage due to its experimental nature.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 32 projectiles.

1457.name: Void Ammo
1457.extraTooltipInfo: The fully realized peak of ammunition technology made from the coalescence of science and magic.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 32 projectiles.

1460.name: High-Grade Whetstone
1460.extraTooltipInfo: To make your weapon perform better than it ever has before.

1461.name: Lesser Imbued Charm
1461.extraTooltipInfo: Imbued energy within this stone is released when casting spells to somewhat empower them.

1462.name: Major Imbued Charm
1462.extraTooltipInfo: Imbued energy within this stone is released when casting spells to empower them.

1463.name: Greater Imbued Charm
1463.extraTooltipInfo: Imbued energy within this stone is released when casting spells to greatly empower them.

1464.name: Ancient Imbued Charm
1464.extraTooltipInfo: Created by a technique lost to time. Massively empowers casted spells.

1465.name: Dwarven Whetstone
1465.extraTooltipInfo: Created by a technique lost to time. Massively improves your weapons performance.

1466.name: Elven Ammo
1466.extraTooltipInfo: Created by a technique lost to time. Whatever magic empowers this ammo massively improves your weapons performance.

1501.name: Snowman Head
1501.extraTooltipInfo: You'd be surprised how comfortable this feels.

1503.name: Lesser Ladle
1503.extraTooltipInfo: This could help you with cooking even if it doesn't look like much! Grants 2 hidden levels of haste while cooking.

1504.name: Ladle
1504.extraTooltipInfo: This could help you with cooking! Grants 2 hidden levels of haste while cooking.

1505.name: Greater Ladle
1505.extraTooltipInfo: For when you're allowed only a single spoonful. Grants 2 hidden levels of haste while cooking.

1506.name: Moss Maul
1506.extraTooltipInfo: A hulking mass of moss covered material; requires a giant's strength to wield properly!

1507.name: Modified Diving Gloves
1507.extraTooltipInfo: There appears to be some remnant of fire magic in these gloves. By researching these, it might be possible to restore those lost effects.

1508.name: King's Crown
1508.extraTooltipInfo: The crown of a Valley's true forever king.

1509.name: Fire Orb
1509.extraTooltipInfo: This orb of living flame sharpens the senses to an inhuman degree.

1510.name: Kalanahmatti
1510.extraTooltipInfo: A mere fragment of the legendary spear 'Kalanahmatti' can still be fashioned into a powerful weapon!

1511.name: Shard of Kalanahmatti
1511.extraTooltipInfo: This powerful blade is fashioned from a shard of the legendary spear 'Kalanahmatti.'

craftingStats.description: Powerful weapon made out of the legendary spear 'Kalanahmatti'.

1512.name: Zero Edge
1512.extraTooltipInfo: Lightning never strikes twice, so surely this is an anomaly.

1513.name: Chaos Crest
1513.extraTooltipInfo: The heat of this helm could empower your smithing abilities!

1514.name: Forgotten Sadness
1514.extraTooltipInfo: Long forgotten in the waves. Can you throw it?

craftingStats.description: Emotionally unstable.

1515.name: Forgotten Madness
1515.extraTooltipInfo: Driven mad by its endless drifting. Appears to channel magical energy.

craftingStats.description: Emotionally unstable.

1516.name: Forgotten Anger
1516.extraTooltipInfo: Perhaps forgotten, absolutely enraged. Only good for melee!

craftingStats.description: Emotionally unstable.

1517.name: Gargoyle Chainmail
1517.extraTooltipInfo: You feel as if you could draw infernal power from this...

craftingStats.description: Requires Defense level of 60 to wield.

1518.name: Gargoyle Legs
1518.extraTooltipInfo: You feel as if you could draw infernal power from this...

craftingStats.description: Requires Defense level of 60 to wield.

1519.name: Gargoyle Boots
1519.extraTooltipInfo: These keep your feet very warm.

1520.name: Gargoyle Helm
1520.extraTooltipInfo: You feel as if you could draw infernal power from this...

craftingStats.description: Requires Defense level of 60 to wield.

1521.name: Gargoyle Shield

craftingStats.description: Requires Defense level of 60 to wield.

1521.extraTooltipInfo: When you research it, you feel a wave of heat. Strange.

1522.name: Gargoyle Falchion

craftingStats.description: Requires Defense level of 60 to wield.

1522.extraTooltipInfo: When you research it, you feel a wave of heat. Strange.

1523.name: Gargoyle Daggers

craftingStats.description: Requires Defense level of 60 to wield.

1523.extraTooltipInfo: When you research it, you feel a wave of heat. Strange.

1524.name: Gargoyle Glaive
1524.extraTooltipInfo: You feel like there is more potential to be unlocked here...

craftingStats.description: Requires Defense level of 60 to wield.

1525.name: Infernal Lance
1525.extraTooltipInfo: A legendary weapon of great prestige and power.

craftingStats.description: Trying to craft this would be madness.

1526.name: Black Knight Great Helm
1526.extraTooltipInfo: A helm of unknown make that grants superhuman strength to its wearer!

1527.name: Chorus of Souls
1527.extraTooltipInfo: It wails with every swing. Unnerving.

1528.name: Decayed Cloak
1528.extraTooltipInfo: Despite its ragged appearance it is immensely durable. What could have caused this damage?

1529.name: Reinforced Cloak
1529.extraTooltipInfo: A standard cloak that has been reinforced to provide some measure of protection in combat.

1530.name: Mysterious Man
1530.extraTooltipInfo: Who are they? What are they? How did they get here?

1531.name: Corny Joke
1531.extraTooltipInfo: You ever heard of this joke? Me neither

1532.name: Death Metal Wig
1532.extraTooltipInfo: Who said Death metal is all evil?

1540.name: Shrimp Carapace
1540.extraTooltipInfo: The chitinous shell of the Aberrant Shrimp formed into armor; it's tainted by some sort of demonic magic. Is this a blessing or a curse?

1541.name: Shrimp Greaves
1541.extraTooltipInfo: The chitinous shell of the Aberrant Shrimp formed into greaves; it's tainted by some sort of demonic magic. Is this a blessing or a curse?

1542.name: Shrimp Helm
1542.extraTooltipInfo: The chitinous shell of the Aberrant Shrimp formed into a helmet; it's tainted by some sort of demonic magic. Is this a blessing or a curse?

1543.name: Shrimp Shell
1543.extraTooltipInfo: The chitinous shell of the Aberrant Shrimp formed into a shield; it's tainted by some sort of demonic magic. Is this a blessing or a curse?

1544.name: Naga's Bracelet
1544.extraTooltipInfo: The liquid inlaid into the carvings seems far too familiar... Wearing the bracelet gives you a craving you cannot describe; if used to create an enchanted piece of jewelry perhaps it will become more apparent to you, but you may run the risk of corrupting its original power...

1545.name: Titanic Gauntlet
1545.extraTooltipInfo: This gauntlet could become so much more if wielded by one with a strong will.

craftingStats.description: This gauntlet could become so much more if wielded by one with a strong will.

1546.name: Awakened World Shaper
1546.extraTooltipInfo: You feel as if infinite power lies within your grasp.

1547.name: Shapeless Scythe
1547.extraTooltipInfo: Its vorpal edge seems to shimmer and distort as you examine it.

1548.name: Giant King's Jewel
1548.extraTooltipInfo: You feel limitless energy pulsing from the jewel.

craftingStats.description: Surely a jewel can be scavenged from these scraps.

1549.name: Giant Scraps
1549.extraTooltipInfo: It would take a master craftsman to reshape this into something usable.

craftingStats.description: A crushed jewel counts as scrap, right?

1550.name: World Walkers
1550.extraTooltipInfo: No terrain is too difficult to traverse with these on.

craftingStats.description: No terrain is too difficult to traverse with these on.

1552.name: Cooked Giant King's Nails
1552.extraTooltipInfo: Why would you eat this? That's disgusting.

1553.name: Crystal Mace
1553.extraTooltipInfo: A manifested shard of chaos. It's able to channel magic fairly well, but seems unstable.

1554.name: Signet Ring
1554.extraTooltipInfo: Carries the signature of some unknown entity.

1555.name: Mantle of Flame
1555.extraTooltipInfo: Wrap yourself in the cozy flames of a dying star and be reborn.

1556.name: Bestial Shawl
1556.extraTooltipInfo: A hunter's shawl designed to give its wearer the ability to easily handle their prey up close or from afar.

1557.name: Hands of Khaast
1557.extraTooltipInfo: You feel as if you could break the world in two with your bare hands and then burn it all down.

1558.name: Shrimp Scraps
1558.extraTooltipInfo: It would take a master craftsman to reshape this into something usable.

1559.name: Black Knight Titan's Helm
1559.extraTooltipInfo: A helm that grants the strength of titans to its wearer!

1560.name: Elven Hood
1560.extraTooltipInfo: A magical hood of elven make.

1561.name: Elven Heavy Armor
1561.extraTooltipInfo: An unnaturally light platebody of elven make.

1562.name: Elven Leggings
1562.extraTooltipInfo: A pair of comfortably fitting leggings of elven make.

1563.name: Elven Boots
1563.extraTooltipInfo: A set of light cavalry boots of elven make.

1564.name: Searing Ladle
1564.extraTooltipInfo: Almost too hot to handle! Burned food rewards full experience. Grants 3 hidden levels of haste while cooking.

1565.name: Black Knight's Gauntlets
1565.extraTooltipInfo: You feel like you could bend steel with these gauntlets on... but what is steel?

1566.name: Bestial Dagger
1566.extraTooltipInfo: A light and deadly dagger able to be wielded in one hand to great effect. Channel your inner beast! Other people won't judge you for it, probably...

1567.name: Empowered Bestial Dagger
1567.extraTooltipInfo: Empowered through magic and sheer rage. A light and deadly dagger able to be wielded in one hand to great effect. Channel your inner beast! Other people won't judge you for it, probably...

1568.name: Bestial Defender
1568.extraTooltipInfo: A light, yet strong, dagger able to be used in the offhand to slightly increase your offensive potential while remaining potent defensively.

1569.name: Empowered Bestial Defender
1569.extraTooltipInfo: Empowered through magic and sheer rage. A light, yet strong, dagger able to be used in the offhand to slightly increase your offensive potential while remaining potent defensively.

1570.name: Elven King's Longbow
1570.extraTooltipInfo: A weapon fit for royalty. Its craftsmanship is unmatched and the method to create weapons such as this is lost to time.

1571.name: Ancient Trident
1571.extraTooltipInfo: A weapon whose origins are lost to time; don't try using it as a fishing harpoon!

1572.name: Fishtail
1572.extraTooltipInfo: A large scimitar taken from a fish! You could probably use it as a paddle!

1573.name: Razorfin
1573.extraTooltipInfo: A large scimitar taken from a fish! Seems particularly magical, but casting magic with a sword this wide will not be the most accurate.

1574.name: Elven Quiver
1574.extraTooltipInfo: A quiver blessed by Elven magic! It appears to retrieve your expended ammunition automatically!

1575.name: Magic Quiver
1575.extraTooltipInfo: A slightly magical quiver that seems to retrieve some of your expended ammunition automatically!

1576.name: Defender's Band
1576.extraTooltipInfo: A ring fashioned from the cornerstone of a great castle.

1577.name: Defender's Pendant
1577.extraTooltipInfo: A pendant fashioned from the cornerstone of a great castle.

1578.name: Scaled Circuit
1578.extraTooltipInfo: Some long forgotten beast's scales wreathe an ancient gemstone.

1579.name: Devourer's Band
1579.extraTooltipInfo: What was, will be. What will be, was.

1580.name: Slayer's Pendant
1580.extraTooltipInfo: A pendant depicting a sword through a skull. Small enough to fit in the palm of your hand!

1581.name: Alacrity Pendant
1581.extraTooltipInfo: A pendant with a lightning bolt engraved on it. Your speed is increased massively while wielding it, but your reflexes are still just as slow, making accuracy a problem.

1582.name: Ring of Taxes
1582.extraTooltipInfo: Allows you to collect taxes from defeated enemies in combat at the expense of your experience. Not even the dead can escape taxes.

1583.name: Wrath and War
1583.extraTooltipInfo: The demonic embodiment of Wrath and War. 'Warth'? Quite mad.

1584.name: Shrimp Scepter
1584.extraTooltipInfo: A scepter formed from the void given shape: the Shrimp God.

craftingStats.description: A staff that could only be fashioned through the help of a Voidblessed Shrimp.

1585.name: Shrimp Stinger
1585.extraTooltipInfo: An off-hand dagger fashioned from one of the Shrimp God's many stingers.

craftingStats.description: A dagger that could only be fashioned through the help of a Voidblessed Shrimp.

1586.name: Shrimp Tail
1586.extraTooltipInfo: A whip designed to mimic the devastating power of a Shrimp's tail.

craftingStats.description: A whip that could only be fashioned through the help of a Voidblessed Shrimp.

1588.name: Hunter's Band
1588.extraTooltipInfo: To mark a true hunter's finest kill.

1589.name: Dwarven Hammer Necklace
1589.extraTooltipInfo: When all you've got is a hammer everything looks like a nail.

1590.name: Ancient Token
1590.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient token that freezes anything it touches.

1591.name: Ancient Ring
1591.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient ring that allows you to control ice. Maybe you should take up ice sculpting and leave the adventuring life behind?

1592.name: Golem Ring
1592.extraTooltipInfo: A ring fashioned from an artificial golem's internals. The magic infused within is said to stabilize the effects of negative affinities, albeit imperfectly.

1593.name: Phroglin Pheromones
1593.extraTooltipInfo: A foul smelling jar filled with a substance that apparently attracts creatures called 'Phroglins.' If used in group combat only the leader's Phroglin Pheromones will be active.

1594.name: Elven Light Armor
1594.extraTooltipInfo: An unnaturally light chainmail of elven make.

1595.name: Elven Hat
1595.extraTooltipInfo: A magical hat of elven make.

1596.name: Sylvan Staff
1596.extraTooltipInfo: A staff stolen from a Spriggan. Requires some druidic aptitude in order to communicate your will to the staff as it is actually a living embodiment of nature.

1597.name: Master Parrying Gauntlet
1597.extraTooltipInfo: A parrying gauntlet for a true master, designed to give you the best chance to parry enemy attacks.

craftingStats.description: A parrying gauntlet for a true master, designed to give you the best chance to parry enemy attacks. Remember to disenchant the Defender piece before crafting this.

1598.name: Expert Parrying Gauntlet
1598.extraTooltipInfo: An expert's tool to more reliably parry enemy attacks. Much more effective than its beginner counterpart.

1599.name: Beginner Parrying Gauntlet
1599.extraTooltipInfo: A beginner's tool to parry and immediately strike an opponent's attack. While it may work sometimes, it's not very reliable.

1600.name: Scroll
1600.extraTooltipInfo: Used in magic to store magical properties: enchantments.

1800.name: Elven Royal Leggings
1800.extraTooltipInfo: A pair of royal leggings that offer an incredible amount of flexibility.

1801.name: Elven Royal Tunic
1801.extraTooltipInfo: A tunic fashioned from sort magical fiber you have never encountered. Not the most protective, but very light.

1802.name: Elven Royal Hat
1802.extraTooltipInfo: Somehow lets you see better while you are wearing it!

1803.name: Infernal Chainmail
1803.extraTooltipInfo: Chain armor supposedly fashioned from the infernal metal of a gargoyle.

1805.name: Infernal Helm
1805.extraTooltipInfo: A fiery countenance that will strike fear into the hearts of your enemies.

1806.name: Symphony of Spirits
1806.extraTooltipInfo: It sings with every swing. You find it almost soothing.

1807.name: Crown of Spikes
1807.extraTooltipInfo: A relic stolen from a collector's hoard. It bears a powerful enchantment that heavily limits your mobility.

1808.name: Dark Ring
1808.extraTooltipInfo: A ring stolen from the Dark Vault; it enhances your combat prowess at the cost of your survivability. It appears to be a crude reconstruction of legendary rings of old.

1809.name: Pendant of Virulence
1809.extraTooltipInfo: This pendant is a magical channel for poison, death, and altogether unpleasant things.

1810.name: Gargoyle Battleaxe
1810.extraTooltipInfo: A rather heavy gargoyle axe. Will you stop using the blunt end already?

1811.name: Infernal Battleaxe
1811.extraTooltipInfo: It's a matter of pride at this point. You will use the blunt end, effectiveness be damned.

1812.name: Infernal Daggers
1812.extraTooltipInfo: Smaller more pointy swords. Easy to handle and very strong. Truly, the pinnacle of stabbing.

1813.name: Infernal Falchion
1813.extraTooltipInfo: A falchion that burns with every cut, but is cool to the touch. How does it produce those flames?

1814.name: Infernal Shield
1814.extraTooltipInfo: It's nearly weightless. No, just holding it makes you feel a bit stronger. This shield defies common sense.

1815.name: Militia Quiver
1815.extraTooltipInfo: A basic quiver to help with your ammo management.

1816.name: Rune Bag
1816.extraTooltipInfo: A basic bag for managing your runes better.

1817.name: Goblin Club
1817.extraTooltipInfo: A club typically wielded by goblins. Its crude nature lets it be more easily wielded by amateurs.

1818.name: Demon Tooth Spear
1818.extraTooltipInfo: A hardy spear tipped with a demon tooth.

1819.name: Log Maul
1819.extraTooltipInfo: It's pretty much just a big log to hit things with.

1820.name: Damaged Goblin Club
1820.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. Could be repaired into a Goblin Club.

1821.name: Sharp Demon Tooth
1821.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. Could be fashioned into a Demon Tooth Spear.

1822.name: Damaged Log Maul
1822.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. Could be repaired into a Log Maul.

1823.name: Soul Fragment
1823.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. Can be used to create weaponized souls or augment those souls.

1824.name: Damaged Militia Sling
1824.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. Could be repaired into a Militia Sling.

1825.name: Damaged Shaman Staff
1825.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. Could be repaired into a Shaman Staff. Is this just a barely magical ladle?

1826.name: Militia Sling
1826.extraTooltipInfo: WIP art asset. A deceptively strong sling used for defense by some farmers and militia recruits. Easy to wield by amateurs.

1827.name: Shaman Staff
1827.extraTooltipInfo: WIP art asset. A staff taken from a Goblin. It seems to just be a big ladle with some charms on it. Useless as a ladle, unfortunately.

craftingStats.description: Needs just a smidgen of gold for engravings and token maintenance.

1828.name: Shattered Forging Hammer
1828.extraTooltipInfo: The broken and cursed remains of an ancient hammer. Its shards are held in place by an unknown force; is it worth meddling with?

1829.name: Broken Hammer Head
1829.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. A shattered hammer head. The pieces cannot be fully joined together, perhaps you can make something of this strange phenomena?

1830.name: Giant Champion's Belt
1830.extraTooltipInfo: An enchanted former armband from a champion of the giants, perfect to fit around your waist instead! Giants are really big, huh?

1831.name: Spiked Cuffs
1831.extraTooltipInfo: Imposing spiked cuffs that appear to increase the deadliness of your glancing blows.

1832.name: Bestial Cloak
1832.extraTooltipInfo: A thick cloak to keep the claws of dangerous game from cutting too deeply.

1833.name: Charred Pelt
1833.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. The pelt taken from a fiery foe. Does not seem damaged at all; it is incredibly durable and light.

1834.name: Wand of the Phoenix
1834.extraTooltipInfo: A wand cradling a dormant Phoenix egg. Its innate heat and magical properties make it an exceptional weapon in the right hands.

craftingStats.description: A wand cradling a dormant Phoenix egg.

1835.name: Dormant Phoenix Egg
1835.extraTooltipInfo: Crafting Material. A dormant Phoenix egg. Identical to a normal Chicken egg, except this one can boil water!

2000.name: Raw Chicken
2000.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. Clucked its last cluck.

2009.name: Spider Legs
2009.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. It is somehow difficult to thread on a skewer.

2010.name: Goblin Brain
2010.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. They are dumb. They are sad. Their brain run by Runecrafting. Beat them.

2012.name: Pepper
2012.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. Don't sneeze or you'll dump too much ore into the forge! Achoo!

2013.name: Salt
2013.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. For some reason it reminds you of yourself. A great chef! ... Probably.

2014.name: Ashes
2014.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. The remnants of life.

craftingStats.description: Cooking Ingredient. The remnants of life.

2015.name: Sugar
2015.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. A sugar rush would definitely make you more efficient!

2016.name: Honey
2016.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. Why do fish like this so much?

2018.name: Butter
2018.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. This really didnt take a lot of effort to make like everyone is saying...

craftingStats.description: Cooking Ingredient. This really didnt take a lot of effort to make like everyone is saying...

2020.name: Mushroom
2020.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. Kinda makes you feel like checking the roots of things.

2021.name: Carrot
2021.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. Build your own snowman kit. Just add water and coal!

2022.name: Chili Pepper
2022.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. So hot you feel like you could almost smelt ores with it!

2024.name: Pumpkin
2024.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. Such a weird melon!

2026.name: Apple
2026.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. Didn't fall far from the tree.

2027.name: Wildberry
2027.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. Like a blueberry, but wild.

2028.name: Banana
2028.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. Gather 'em up in bunches!

2029.name: Wheat
2029.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. How many of these do I need to make a Straw Hat?

2030.name: Rice
2030.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. You're telling me a Limpe fried this rice?

2031.name: Sageberry
2031.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. The ultimate big brain berry.

2032.name: Choccy Milk
2032.extraTooltipInfo: Cooking Ingredient. Do you even know what chocolate is? ... Well, it's brown.

2034.name: Filleted Fish
2034.extraTooltipInfo: Sashimi! You should probably cook these.

2037.name: Churned Dairy
2037.extraTooltipInfo: Tide you over till you cook real food.

2039.name: Diced Fruit
2039.extraTooltipInfo: Fruit salad. Cook these for more nutrition!

2040.name: Chopped Vegetables
2040.extraTooltipInfo: You're not sure if that tomato belongs here. Cook these for a hearty meal.

2045.name: Sour Essence
2045.extraTooltipInfo: Essence extracted from sour foods. Used in alchemy.

2046.name: Bitter Essence
2046.extraTooltipInfo: Essence extracted from bitter foods. Used in alchemy.

2047.name: Sweet Essence
2047.extraTooltipInfo: Essence extracted from sweet foods. Used in alchemy.

2048.name: Spicy Essence
2048.extraTooltipInfo: Essence extracted from spicy foods. Used in alchemy.

2049.name: Seed Oil
2049.extraTooltipInfo: Made by pressing seeds. Cooking Ingredient.

2100.name: Questionable Food
2100.extraTooltipInfo: You're not quite sure what this is supposed to be. Are you really going to eat it?

2103.name: Seared Fish
2103.extraTooltipInfo: You're not entirely sure which fish this is, but it's definitely seared!

2104.name: Seared Poultry
2104.extraTooltipInfo: It's not fried but it'll do.

2105.name: Birdie Pasta
2105.extraTooltipInfo: The invention of a true madman.

2107.name: Sushi
2107.extraTooltipInfo: Wait, is the fish raw or not?

Stacks with non-coalescing totems that have the same effect. Only the oldest coalescing totem will take effect. The totem will automatically expire when it is fully grown.
