9032.name: Cursed Spade Head
9032.extraTooltipInfo: The head of a broken spade, evidently used to unearth some forgotten evil. With the right process you could use it to find these crypts...

9033.name: Dark Vault Key
9033.extraTooltipInfo: A brutish key made of dark metal, slotted with a crystal, rumored to unlock hidden treasures within the Dark Vault.

craftingStats.description: Grants one-time access to the Dark Vault dungeon. This is a trio encounter.

9034.name: Dark Vault Identification Crystal
9034.extraTooltipInfo: An intact identification crystal. Can be used to fashion a key to gain access to the Dark Vault.

9035.name: Prismatic Pudding
9035.extraTooltipInfo: The only dish capable of granting you entry to the Master Chicken's Kitchen. The Final Flan!

9036.name: Prismatic Extract
9036.extraTooltipInfo: Like vanilla extract, but magical. Can be used with dairy to make the fabled Prismatic Pudding and challenge the Master Chicken Chef.

10001.name: Dextrous Scraps
10001.extraTooltipInfo: Perhaps you could salvage something dextrous from these scraps...

10002.name: Intellectual Scraps
10002.extraTooltipInfo: Perhaps you could salvage something intellectual from these scraps...

10003.name: Gem Package
10003.extraTooltipInfo: A bag of gems! I wonder what's inside? ...Gems, hopefully.

10004.name: Sealed Scroll
10004.extraTooltipInfo: A sealed scroll. Doesn't come with postal information, so I guess it's yours now! What could its contents be?

10005.name: Small Gathering Supply Crate
10005.extraTooltipInfo: A small crate addressed to someone named 'Diet$melter.' Sounds like a fake name, you should open it!

10006.name: Gathering Supply Crate
10006.extraTooltipInfo: A crate addressed to someone named 'Diet$melter.' Sounds like a fake name, you should open it!

10007.name: Large Gathering Supply Crate
10007.extraTooltipInfo: A large crate addressed to someone named 'Diet$melter.' Sounds like a fake name, you should open it!

10008.name: Bucket of Worms
10008.extraTooltipInfo: A bucket of soil with worms inside! At least it isn't just a can of worms!

10009.name: Box of Skill Books
10009.extraTooltipInfo: An ornate lockbox containing a variety of skill books. Testing Item.

10010.name: Box of Jewelry
10010.extraTooltipInfo: An ornate lockbox containing a variety of skill books. Testing Item.

10011.name: Magic Starter Kit
10011.extraTooltipInfo: A simple pouch containing some starter supplies. Will eventually be tied to a tutorial quest.

10012.name: Range Starter Kit
10012.extraTooltipInfo: A simple pouch containing some starter supplies. Will eventually be tied to a tutorial quest.

10013.name: Lesser Jewelry Cache
10013.extraTooltipInfo: A small cache of jewelry, might contain something useful.

10014.name: Greater Jewelry Cache
10014.extraTooltipInfo: A grand cache of jewelry, might contain something useful.

10015.name: Goblin Cache
10015.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from a Goblin Settlement. Smells like one too.

10016.name: Dark Cache
10016.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from a Dark Fortress. It feels powerful.

10017.name: Giant Cache
10017.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from the Giants Keep. It's incredibly heavy.

10018.name: Elder Cache
10018.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from the Elders Ruin. It looks very elegant.

10019.name: Overgrown Cache
10019.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from an Old Castle. Old and covered in moss.

10020.name: Barrows Cache
10020.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from the Ancient Barrows. It's a bit dusty but still obviously valuable.

10021.name: Flaming Cache
10021.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from the Palace of Flames. It's still warm.

10022.name: Storm Cache
10022.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from the Eye of the Storm. You feel as if you're being watched.

10023.name: Maelstrom Cache
10023.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from the Maelstrom. It whispers to you.

10024.name: INFO Cache
10024.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from INFO themself. They see you as worthy. At least a bit.

10026.name: Dwarven Research Cache
10026.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from a Dwarven Research Station. What secrets does it contain?

10027.name: Elven Research Cache
10027.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from the Nature Athaneum. What secrets does it contain?

10028.name: Academy Research Cache
10028.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from the Abandoned Academy Base. What lost secrets does it contain?

10029.name: Dark Vault Cache
10029.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from the Dark Vault. What treasures does it contain?

10030.name: Chicken Kitchen Cache
10030.extraTooltipInfo: A cache containing loot from the Master Chicken's Kitchen. What does it contain?

11000.name: Novice Tacklebox
11000.extraTooltipInfo: A beginner's novice tacklebox designed to be used by children. Not much good to catch anything large.

craftingStats.description: A novice fishing tacklebox. Gives 3 fishing levels, 15 bait power and 5 reel power.

11001.name: Basic Tacklebox
11001.extraTooltipInfo: A basic fishing tacklebox aimed for use by hobbyists and amateurs for basic fishing adventures to the local river or pond.

craftingStats.description: A basic fishing tacklebox. Gives 6 fishing levels, 20 bait power, 10 reel power, and 3 bonus rarity.

11002.name: Advanced Tacklebox
11002.extraTooltipInfo: An advanced fishing tacklebox for those who've gotten more than their toes wet in fishing.

craftingStats.description: An advanced fishing tacklebox. Gives 9 fishing levels, 25 bait power, 15 reel power, and 6 bonus rarity.

11003.name: Pro Tacklebox
11003.extraTooltipInfo: The pro fishing tacklebox has nearly everything you could possibly need to catch fish.

craftingStats.description: A pro fishing tacklebox! Gives 12 fishing levels, 30 bait power, 20 reel power, and 10 bonus rarity.

11004.name: Supreme Tacklebox
11004.extraTooltipInfo: A supreme fishing tacklebox rife with all the bits and bobs a master fisherman would need to fish up just about anything.

craftingStats.description: A supreme fishing tacklebox! Gives 15 fishing levels, 35 bait power, 25 reel power, and 15 bonus rarity.

11005.name: Ocean's Embrace
11005.extraTooltipInfo: The origin of this mythical equipment is lost to history but there is no doubt regarding its power.

craftingStats.description: The ultimate fishing implement! Gives 40 fishing levels, 100 bait power, 100 reel power, and 60 bonus rarity.
Each craft results in 5 bait.
Each craft results in 3 bait.

11015.name: Smelly Meat Bait
11015.extraTooltipInfo: Some smelly, probably not rotten, meat.

11016.name: Hardened Hook Bait
11016.extraTooltipInfo: A hook designed to make reeling in big catches easier. Has a flat +15% chance of being preserved.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 12 bait.

11017.name: Alluring Lure Bait
11017.extraTooltipInfo: A shiny lure designed to entice even the most wary catches. Has a flat +15% chance of being preserved.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 14 bait.

11018.name: Writhing Tentacle Bait
11018.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient writhing tentacle that reacts when you poke it.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 6 bait. A writhing tentacle that reacts when you poke it.

11019.name: Mysterious Bait
11019.extraTooltipInfo: Who knows what effects using this bait would have? Each and every one of them is unique! Each bait has between +50 and +200 to all fishing stat.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 3 bait.
Each craft results in 3 bait.

11022.name: Improved Hook Bait
11022.extraTooltipInfo: An improved hook for improving your equipment bonuses. Has a flat +15% chance of being preserved.

craftingStats.description: Each craft results in 12 bait.

11030.name: Rotten Driftwood
11030.extraTooltipInfo: A rotten piece of driftwood. Could it still be used for something?

11031.name: Sturdy Driftwood
11031.extraTooltipInfo: A sturdy piece of driftwood. Could it still be used for something?

11032.name: Aquamarine
11032.extraTooltipInfo: An aquamarine crystal. If you hold it up to your ear you can look like an idiot!

11033.name: Ancient Fishing Rod
11033.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient fishing rod, straight out of a madman's fantasy. Not much good on its own in this condition; it would take a master crafter to repair it...

11034.name: Ancient Harpoon
11034.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient harpoon, probably dragged up from some ancient aquatic ruin. Not much good on its own in this condition; it would take a master crafter to repair it...

11035.name: Ancient Fishing Net
11035.extraTooltipInfo: An ancient fishing net, the material it's made out of appears to be alive. Not much good on its own in this condition; it would take a master crafter to repair it...

11036.name: Mystical Driftwood
11036.extraTooltipInfo: An oddly glowing piece of driftwood. Could it still be used for something?

11037.name: Dwarven Alloy
11037.extraTooltipInfo: An alloy made from metals you do not recognize.

11038.name: Dwarven Ingot
11038.extraTooltipInfo: An incredibly hard dwarven ingot. It is basically impossible to work with.

11039.name: Dwarven Mold
11039.extraTooltipInfo: A sort of mold to form a tool with.

11041.name: Elder Sap
11041.extraTooltipInfo: Sap taken from a tree that is much older than you are.

12000.name: Fisherman's Smock
12000.extraTooltipInfo: A smock for fishing! You can already feel it making your tools stronger.

12001.name: Fisherman's Bucket Hat
12001.extraTooltipInfo: A hat for fishing! You can already feel it making your reflexes sharper.

12002.name: Fisherman's Waders
12002.extraTooltipInfo: Waders for fishing! You can already feel it making your ability to bait fish stronger.

12003.name: Miner's Smock
12003.extraTooltipInfo: A smock to rub the coal dust on after a long day in the mines.

12004.name: Miner's Lantern Helmet
12004.extraTooltipInfo: OSHA approved! Lets you see better! Wow!

12005.name: Miner's Trousers
12005.extraTooltipInfo: A pair of trousers that you swear definitely makes you better at mining despite being a simple pair of pants. Are they magical? Probably not. Probably.

12006.name: Lumberjack's Vest
12006.extraTooltipInfo: Makes you want to shout timber.

12007.name: Lumberjack's Hat
12007.extraTooltipInfo: If a tree falls on your head this will not help, but it can keep you warm!

12008.name: Lumberjack's Trousers
12008.extraTooltipInfo: You're a lumberjack and you're okay!

12009.name: Fishing Shard
12009.extraTooltipInfo: A shard for creating skilling gear.

12010.name: Mining Shard
12010.extraTooltipInfo: A shard for creating skilling gear.

12011.name: Foraging Shard
12011.extraTooltipInfo: A shard for creating skilling gear.

12012.name: Prismatic Dust
12012.extraTooltipInfo: A fine dust that radiates a prismatic luster; formed when too much power is imbued into a Black Opal

12013.name: Chef's Hat
12013.extraTooltipInfo: Kinda smells like your childhood meals. They must have really sucked since this hat came from a Goblin.

12014.name: Infernal Dust
12014.extraTooltipInfo: A fine dust that is fueled by some inner flame. Formed when too much power is imbued into Obsidian.

12015.name: Golden Spoon
12015.extraTooltipInfo: It's a golden spoon! Rewards full XP when burning food and grants 4 hidden levels of haste while cooking.

craftingStats.description: It's a golden spoon! Rewards full XP when burning food and grants 4 hidden levels of haste while cooking.

12016.name: Cooking Shard
12016.extraTooltipInfo: A shard for creating skilling gear.

12017.name: Runecrafting Shard
12017.extraTooltipInfo: A shard for creating skilling gear.

12018.name: Camo Cloak
12018.extraTooltipInfo: A cloak with camo elements to help you avoid fights in dangerous places. Increases your combat ability in dangerous gathering encounters and gathering dungeons.

12019.name: Flamboyant Cape
12019.extraTooltipInfo: A bright, flamboyant cape designed to catch the eye of monsters. Increases your combat ability in dangerous gathering encounters and gathering dungeons.

12020.name: Small Bag of Holding
12020.extraTooltipInfo: A small bag that possesses some magic to help you gather all that you can from a resource. Will automatically be upgraded to the next bag of holding tier at +5 augment levels.

12021.name: Bag of Holding
12021.extraTooltipInfo: A bag that possesses some magic to help you gather all that you can from a resource. Will automatically be upgraded to the next bag of holding tier at +7 augment levels.

12022.name: Large Bag of Holding
12022.extraTooltipInfo: A large bag that possesses some magic to help you gather all that you can from a resource.

12023.name: Newbie Adventurer's Backpack
12023.extraTooltipInfo: A backpack with all the goodies and supplies necessary to help an adventurer get more research done when gathering in the field. May require some adjustment by a new owner before becoming comfortable to wear!

12024.name: Dwarven Adventurer's Backpack
12024.extraTooltipInfo: A redesigned backpack drawing from dwarven research to massively increase research capabilities when gathering out in the field. May require some significant adjustment by a new owner before becoming comfortable to wear!

12025.name: Cloak of Many Pockets
12025.extraTooltipInfo: A cloak with many pockets to keep you more organized while processing materials.

12026.name: Cloak of the Void
12026.extraTooltipInfo: A cloak with access to a small pocket dimension for storage. Greatly increases your ability to stay organized and efficient while processing materials.

12027.name: Dwarven Manufacturing Pendant
12027.extraTooltipInfo: Empowers you to hastily process materials and items.

12028.name: Elven Logistics Pendant
12028.extraTooltipInfo: Empowers you to efficiently process materials and items.

12029.name: Farming Shard
12029.extraTooltipInfo: A shard for creating skilling gear.

12030.name: Dwarven Tongs
12030.extraTooltipInfo: A legendary set of tongs made from lost dwarven technology.

craftingStats.description: A legendary set of tongs made from lost dwarven technology.

12031.name: Smithing Shard
12031.extraTooltipInfo: A shard for creating skilling gear.

12032.name: Elvish Hoe
12032.extraTooltipInfo: A legendary farming implement purportedly used by the Elves. Why does it need a diamond?

craftingStats.description: A legendary farming implement purportedly used by the Elves. Why does it need a diamond?

12033.name: Void Portal Anchor
12033.extraTooltipInfo: An anchor point for a void portal that can be used to create legendary equipment.

12034.name: Defunct Golem Core
12034.extraTooltipInfo: Ancient dwarven tech that could be repurposed into a legendary piece of equipment.

12035.name: Lava Heart
12035.extraTooltipInfo: A mechanical heart that pumps molten stone instead of blood. With the right equipment it could enhance your Smithing capabilities.

12036.name: Bleached Cloth
12036.extraTooltipInfo: A bolt of cloth bleached white by time that possesses a hint of intrinsic magical power. It appears to have absorbed some forgotten Cooking techniques in this Library. Knowledge Osmosis!

12037.name: Academy Wards
12037.extraTooltipInfo: Various totems and curios that were used to contain magical energy. They could be repurposed to help channel magic while Runecrafting.

12038.name: Smith's Golem Torso
12038.extraTooltipInfo: A stony torso powered by lava.

12039.name: Smith's Golem Legs
12039.extraTooltipInfo: A stony set of legs powered by lava.

12040.name: Chef's Coat
12040.extraTooltipInfo: Signifies your prestige and mastery of Cooking.

12041.name: Chef's Pants
12041.extraTooltipInfo: Every chef needs a comfortable pair of pants!

12042.name: Runecrafter's Robe Top
12042.extraTooltipInfo: A robe top that can help you channel and shape magic into slates and fibers.

12043.name: Runecrafter's Robe Hood
12043.extraTooltipInfo: A hood that can help you channel and shape magic into slates and fibers.

12044.name: Runecrafter's Robe Bottoms
12044.extraTooltipInfo: A robe bottom that can help you channel and shape magic into slates and fibers.

13000.name: Combat Manual - Volume 1
13000.extraTooltipInfo: A manual on how to take advantage of your weapon's edge. Apparently using the sharp part means it will hurt something more, who could have known?

13001.name: Combat Manual - Volume 2
13001.extraTooltipInfo: A manual on how to take poke things really good. If the weapon has a decent tip, you can stab things! Wow!

13002.name: Combat Manual - Volume 3
13002.extraTooltipInfo: A manual on how to just hit things hard. Crushing things is deceptively simple and to truly pummel your enemy you must understand that being blunt is sometimes the only way to go.

13003.name: Spell Tome - Fire Ball
13003.extraTooltipInfo: A basic tome from the Academy formerly used for teaching aspiring mages how to control and utilize fire. Be careful where you practice it!

13004.name: Spell Tome - Flamethrower
13004.extraTooltipInfo: An intermediate tome from the Academy formerly used for teaching mages how to utilize flames in a more lively manner.

13005.name: Ballistics 101
13005.extraTooltipInfo: A textbook that explains the basic principles regarding how something that goes up usually comes back down.

13006.name: Projectile Based Diplomacy - I
13006.extraTooltipInfo: A book that outline the merits of using projectiles, preferably several at once, to really get your point across.

13007.name: Projectile Based Diplomacy - II
13007.extraTooltipInfo: A book that outline the merits of using projectiles, even just a single well placed one, to really get your point across.

13008.name: Projectile Based Diplomacy - III
13008.extraTooltipInfo: A book that outline the merits of using projectiles, especially when trying to distract and divert, to really get your point across.

13009.name: Apocalyptic Tome
13009.extraTooltipInfo: A spell tome that contains the necessary rituals and rites for summoning your own miniature apocalypse.

13010.name: Intermediate Combat Manual - Volume 1
13010.extraTooltipInfo: A manual on how to hit two enemies at once in one swing.

13011.name: City Decree
13011.extraTooltipInfo: Grants the owner the ability to summon City Guards as reinforcements in combat. You should probably feel a little guilty if you bring them into a fight they cannot survive.

13012.name: How To - First Aid
13012.extraTooltipInfo: Teaches the fundamentals of mid-combat first aid rending.

13013.name: Defending the Weak - An Excerpt
13013.extraTooltipInfo: A few pages that explain that you can actually use your shield to defend others instead of just yourself.

13014.name: Combat Manual - Volume 4
13014.extraTooltipInfo: A manual on stabbing through one enemy and into the next one. A battle cry is optional but recommended!

13015.name: Attention Getting Tactics
13015.extraTooltipInfo: It's a long scroll that explains in detail how awful you are. It gives you ideas on what to say to other people! Very healthy.

13016.name: Smoke and Mirrors
13016.extraTooltipInfo: How to use the deceit and chaos to your aid on the battlefield.

13017.name: All Ghillied Up
13017.extraTooltipInfo: Sticks, grass, leaves, and other foliage can make a proper bush out of you!

13019.name: Trapper's Guide
13019.extraTooltipInfo: Setting traps is just one of the many ways you may shape the battlefield.

13020.name: Spell Tome - Ice Shard
13020.extraTooltipInfo: A basic tome from the Academy formerly used for teaching aspiring mages how to control and utilize ice.

13021.name: Notes on Acid - I
13021.extraTooltipInfo: Notes taken while engaging enemies that could use acid in combat. Perhaps there is a way to mimic this ability?

13022.name: Notes on Acid - II
13022.extraTooltipInfo: Notes taken while engaging enemies that could use acid in combat. Perhaps there is a way to mimic this ability?

13023.name: Armor and its Weaknesses
13023.extraTooltipInfo: Notes on the various types of armor and how smarter monsters react to them. Perhaps there is something to learn here?

13024.name: Cultist Notes I
13024.extraTooltipInfo: The ravings of a madman, outlining the necessary ritual to cast some sort of spell.

13025.name: Cultist Notes II
13025.extraTooltipInfo: The ravings of a madman, outlining the necessary ritual to cast some sort of spell. This time it is written in blood!

13026.name: Enlightened Parchment
13026.extraTooltipInfo: A mostly nonsensical rant that claims to know the truth of all things. It does present some potential magical implications...

13027.name: A Study on Anatomy I
13027.extraTooltipInfo: Describes the bone structure of most humanoids and non-humanoid creatures. It also describes how to break them.

13028.name: A Study on Anatomy II
13028.extraTooltipInfo: Describes the location of tendons in most creatures. They are surprisingly easy to reach.

13029.name: A Study on Anatomy III
13029.extraTooltipInfo: Describes non-vital organs in creatures. The vitals may be well protected, but a non-vital strike will still significantly hamper anything.

13030.name: Trapper's Guide, the Sequel
13030.extraTooltipInfo: Setting traps is just one of the many ways you may shape the battlefield. So why not just put down a ton?

13031.name: Ancient Ice Tome
13031.extraTooltipInfo: This old tome outlines the methods to magically contain certain specimen. Perhaps it can be used in combat too?

15000.name: Slayer's Mark
15000.extraTooltipInfo: A type of trophy taken from a slain foe.

15001.name: Token of Ownership
15001.extraTooltipInfo: A token representing that some item was obtained.

15002.name: Token of Action
15002.extraTooltipInfo: A token representing that some action was completed.

15003.name: Talent Respec Token
15003.extraTooltipInfo: Allows a full respec of your talent tree. Consumed on use! Untradeable version.

15004.name: Tradeable Talent Respec Token
15004.extraTooltipInfo: Allows a full respec of your talent tree. Consumed on use! Tradeable version.

16000.name: Wooden Cup
16000.extraTooltipInfo: An enchanted wooden cup that occasionally leaks out barely drinkable water.

16001.name: Wooden Goblet
16001.extraTooltipInfo: A more refined wooden cup. At least it can hold the water it conjures, but it is more useful for purifying water you find.

16002.name: Wooden Chalice
16002.extraTooltipInfo: A fancy wooden chalice with engravings. No leaks and the water is never outright muddy. Getting better!

16003.name: Refined Wooden Chalice
16003.extraTooltipInfo: A wooden chalice inlaid with cheap gems. They might actually be colored glass, but they may be enchanted to somewhat cool the conjured and cleaned water.

16004.name: Exquisite Wooden Chalice
16004.extraTooltipInfo: A large wooden chalice resembling a trophy! Clear, cool water is always available to drink. Very fancy, but still made of wood.

16005.name: Small Silver Cup
16005.extraTooltipInfo: A small silver cup. The water drawn from this cup is magically refreshing, but low in quantity. Very delicate and worth more than wood.

16006.name: Silver Goblet
16006.extraTooltipInfo: A larger silver cup. Magically refreshing water that you can take more than a couple sips at a time from!

16007.name: Silver Chalice
16007.extraTooltipInfo: An enchanted silver chalice. Has handles!

16008.name: Refined Silver Chalice
16008.extraTooltipInfo: A silver chalice of fine craftsmanship with decorative engravings. Whether or not these engravings bolster its ability to conjure water is still up for debate.

16009.name: Exquisite Silver Chalice
16009.extraTooltipInfo: A hefty silver chalice that would not be out of place in a rich wizard's tower as an artifact of some note. You can almost hear a healthy burbling stream when it produces water.

16010.name: Tall Gold Goblet
16010.extraTooltipInfo: A small golden cup, barely able to contain any liquid, but very expensive nonetheless. What little liquid it produces matches the taste of the drinker perfectly.

16011.name: Wide Gold Goblet
16011.extraTooltipInfo: A wide golden cup, but now wide instead of tall! Supports even more flavors!

16012.name: Golden Chalice
16012.extraTooltipInfo: A golden chalice inlaid with real gems. The gems seem to sparkle and glow of their own volition, allowing the produced liquid to be either hot or cold. There is no doubt to your wealth when you drink from this.

16013.name: Refined Golden Chalice
16013.extraTooltipInfo: A large golden chalice inlaid with engravings. The engravings seem to glow faintly, and the liquid produced is always the perfect temperature.

16014.name: Exquisite Golden Chalice
16014.extraTooltipInfo: A huge golden chalice with engravings AND gems! Enchanted gems and glowing engravings indicate that this chalice is an artifact of some renown, capable of supplying an entire noble house with any beverage they may desire.

16015.name: Golden Grail
16015.extraTooltipInfo: A veritable cauldron made of pure gold and inlaid with precious gems. Did you take this from a king, or did you become one just to own it? It deserves its own castle for how much it is worth. 'Property of Habs' is written on the bottom.

25000.name: Monster Tooth
25000.extraTooltipInfo: A tooth taken from a slain monster; might be worth something to someone.

25001.name: Monster Horn
25001.extraTooltipInfo: A horn taken from a slain monster; might be worth something to someone.

25002.name: Sturdy Horn
25002.extraTooltipInfo: A sturdy horn taken from a slain monster; might be worth something to someone.

25003.name: Old Coins
25003.extraTooltipInfo: Some old coins. Might be worth something to a collector

25004.name: Primitive Coin
25004.extraTooltipInfo: A rather heavy, yet primitive, gold coin. This could easily be sold for a tidy sum.

25005.name: Undead Token
25005.extraTooltipInfo: Some sort of token taken from the undead. Someone might be interested in it.

25006.name: Woodland Trinket
25006.extraTooltipInfo: A trinket taken from the Elves; might be worth something to someone.

25007.name: Intact Wing
25007.extraTooltipInfo: A mostly intact wing. Someone might be interested in it.

25008.name: Ornate Trinket
25008.extraTooltipInfo: A rather ornate trinket; it should be worth a bit.

25009.name: Useless Metal Scraps
25009.extraTooltipInfo: Useless metal scraps made from some poor quality material. Could probably be sold to someone for cheap.

25010.name: Exotic Trinket
25010.extraTooltipInfo: An exotic trinket from some unknown origin. Should be worth quite a bit to the right person.

25011.name: Demonic Statue
25011.extraTooltipInfo: A statue made from some sort of gem-like material depicting a small demon. May be worth quite a bit if you can find a buyer.

25012.name: Monster Claws
25012.extraTooltipInfo: Claws taken from a slain monster; might be worth something to someone.

25013.name: Bottled Blood
25013.extraTooltipInfo: Slightly magical blood taken from something. May be valuable to someone.

25014.name: Broken Armaments
25014.extraTooltipInfo: Shattered pieces of equipment that probably is not worth salvaging by you; perhaps someone else may want to buy it.

25015.name: Creature Eggs
25015.extraTooltipInfo: Eggs from some creature. Probably best to get rid of this quickly.

25016.name: Dwarven Coins
25016.extraTooltipInfo: Shiny dwarven coins that are of no use to you. A vendor could exchange the currency.

25017.name: Bone Shards
25017.extraTooltipInfo: Splinters of bone taken from a slain creature. Might be worth something to someone.

25018.name: Giant Heart
25018.extraTooltipInfo: A giant heart, probably taken from a giant or similarly large creature. Superstition suggests making a meal with it will increase your attractiveness, but sadly that may be a wasted effort on you.

25019.name: Ancient Armor Scraps
25019.extraTooltipInfo: Scraps of some ancient piece of equipment. Its origin is unknown, but it may be worth something to the right person.

25020.name: Unknown Rune
25020.extraTooltipInfo: It appears to be a rune not created through conventional means. It is no use to you but someone may want it.

25021.name: Light Armor Scraps
25021.extraTooltipInfo: Pieces of light armor that is too damaged to salvage. Might be worth something to someone.

25022.name: Armor Scraps
25022.extraTooltipInfo: Pieces of armor that is too damaged to salvage. Might be worth something to someone.

25023.name: Heavy Armor Scraps
25023.extraTooltipInfo: Pieces of heavy armor that is too damaged to salvage. Might be worth something to someone.

25024.name: Tusk
25024.extraTooltipInfo: A tusk taken from a slain monster; might be worth something to someone.

25025.name: Gem Shards
25025.extraTooltipInfo: Useless pieces of shattered gems. Not quite fine enough to be considered dust, but too small for you to properly refine or cut. Might be worth something to a vendor.

25026.name: Goblin Fork
25026.extraTooltipInfo: A useless eating utensil used by goblins. Everyone knows you should just eat your meals whole! A vendor may want this.

25027.name: Nature Stone
25027.extraTooltipInfo: A chunk of stone that appears to be imbued with life. Useless to you, but must be valuable to someone.

25028.name: Fire Stone
25028.extraTooltipInfo: A chunk of stone that appears to be imbued with flame. Useless to you, but must be valuable to someone.

25029.name: Ice Stone
25029.extraTooltipInfo: A chunk of stone that appears to be imbued with ice. Useless to you, but must be valuable to someone.

25030.name: A Diamond Plated Bug
25030.extraTooltipInfo: I wonder who added this in? Some nerd probably.

25031.name: Valuable Furs
25031.extraTooltipInfo: Worthless for making equipment out of but may be worth something to a vendor.

25032.name: Metal Slag
25032.extraTooltipInfo: Slag from Smithing; it is completely useless to you but a vendor may be convinced to buy it.

100000.name: ban_hamer
100000.extraTooltipInfo: with this hammer you can play whac-a-mole more efficiently
